alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 1:19AM AKST until December 26 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST EARLY THIS MORNING ALONG THE SEWARD HIGHWAY FROM TURNAGAIN PASS TO NORTH OF SEWARD... * WHAT...Freezing Rain. Ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph through Portage Valley and Whittier. * WHERE...Seward Highway from Turnagain Pass to north of Seward. * WHEN...Until 5 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery roads and hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Area of freezing rain are expected to continue along sheltered areas of the Seward Highway, mainly from Turnagain Pass to north of Seward. For Seward and Portage Valley, warmer air has pushed temperatures above freezing, transitioning the precipitation to all rain. Even though air temperatures are above freezing for these locations, rain on frozen roadway surfaces could cause roads to remain icy. Rainfall may also lead to ponding on area area roads, especially around Portage Valley.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
